decks.notes: The main strategy of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to flood the board with cheap artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Signal Pest, then pump them up with cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes mana ramp with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to get ahead on board early. Arcbound Ravager and Vault Skirge provide additional versatility and resilience. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Blast adds some reach to finish off opponents. The deck aims to close out games quickly and aggressively before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and removal spells, utilizing a combination of efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The mana base is designed to support a streamlined gameplan of efficiently deploying threats and disrupting opponent's game plan. The deck seeks to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal, and efficient creatures to chip away at the opponent's life total and eventually secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and land disruption. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and using Spreading Seas to disrupt their mana base. The deck also focuses on card advantage through the use of Ancestral Vision and Serum Visions, allowing the player to keep a full grip of cards. The win condition of the deck is to control the board and eventually win through the use of Celestial Colonnade, Snapcaster Mage, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Elspeth.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively lower your own life total in order to increase the power of Death's Shadow, a key creature in the deck. By using cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to cycle through your deck quickly, along with thoughtseize and inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt your opponent's game plan, you can quickly put pressure on your opponent and close out the game with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil. The deck focuses on a fast and disruptive strategy to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to rapidly play and put pressure on the opponent with powerful and disruptive Eldrazi creatures. The deck aims to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and unleash massive Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of aggressive creatures, high mana production, and disruption make this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw. By efficiently handling threats with cards like Terminate and Lightning Bolt, while also having access to powerful counterspells like Cryptic Command and Countersquall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision and Snapcaster Mage to ensure a steady stream of resources and maintain control throughout the game.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering opponent's spells, disrupting their game plan, and gaining card advantage through card draw and recursion abilities. It also utilizes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command to control the board. The deck aims to stabilize the game and eventually win through card advantage and powerful finishers like Vendilion Clique and Platinum Emperion. Additionally, it includes sideboard options like Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases. The ultimate goal is to outlast the opponent and win the game through efficient control and powerful threats.

This Bant Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Spell Queller, the deck can deploy threats at instant speed and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Knight of the Reliquary provide additional value and power to push damage through. With a mix of creatures, removal, and disruptive elements, this deck looks to apply pressure early and maintain board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to power up the Death's Shadow creatures, while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient, utilizing high-value threats like Tarmogoyf and efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to control the board. The Liliana planeswalkers provide additional value and disruption, helping to close out games against slower opponents. This deck is all about balancing risk and reward to come out ahead in the end.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and lands to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It capitalizes on the synergy between artifacts, using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum for mana acceleration, and Cranial Plating for boosting creature power. Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium further enhance the board presence, while Galvanic Blast provides reach and removal. The deck aims to quickly build a formidable board state and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and using them to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining powerful disruptive creatures like Spell Queller and Voice of Resurgence with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to out-tempo the opponent and apply pressure early on. Knight of the Reliquary and Tireless Tracker provide additional value and card advantage, while Collected Company can help dig for more threats. The land base is built to support the aggressive strategy, with utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Gavony Township.

This deck focuses on aggressively using life as a resource to power up Death's Shadow, a strong creature that gets bigger as your life total decreases. The deck runs efficient removal spells and hand disruption to control the game while quickly deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow. By using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to manipulate the top of the deck, the deck aims to take advantage of the graveyard to enable powerful plays. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to provide additional value and assistance in closing out games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with low-cost artifacts and use cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal fast, efficient damage to the opponent. Key cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer help to pump up creatures and create powerful board states, while cards like Etched Champion and Vault Skirge provide resilience and protection. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive threats and close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to control the board and combo off efficiently. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the deck can potentially search for key combo pieces like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Kitchen Finks to gain infinite life, or Archangel of Thune and Spike Feeder for infinite +1/+1 counters. With access to Viscera Seer and combo enablers like Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit, the deck can quickly set up powerful board states and overwhelm opponents with its versatile creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to take advantage of the Death's Shadow creature's power and toughness ability, while also disrupting your opponent's hand and board using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck is designed to be aggressive and fast, using efficient removal spells and delve creatures to control the board and pressure the opponent. By efficiently managing your life total and resources, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap artifacts and pump them up with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to deal massive amounts of damage. The key strategy is to utilize the synergy between the artifact creatures, equipment, and pump spells to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also has some protection and card draw built in to help maintain momentum and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing efficient threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells. It aims to pressure the opponent with early creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer while using removal spells like Path to Exile and Fatal Push to deal with threats. The deck also has powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate value and control the board. Lingering Souls provides a steady stream of creatures, and cards like Nihil Spellbomb help to disrupt graveyard strategies. The mana base allows for fixing and flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek, while using Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent by triggering Valakut's ability. Additionally, cards like Through the Breach and Scapeshift can be used to cheat out Primeval Titan, further accelerating the combo potential. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods for control and disruption, creating a versatile and aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of this Affinity deck is to flood the board with low-cost artifacts and quickly pump them up with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to deal massive damage to the opponent. Using efficient evasive creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest, along with powerful finishers like Master of Etherium and Galvanic Blast, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a quick and aggressive assault. The deck also utilizes key lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Blinkmoth Nexus to provide additional threats and alternate win conditions.

The deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf. By using cards like Mishra's Bauble, Street Wraith, and Thoughtseize to manipulate your life total and disrupt your opponent's strategy, you can quickly build a formidable board presence. With efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command, along with powerful threats like Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to apply relentless pressure and disrupt your opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive threats at a rapid pace. The deck utilizes cards like Eldrazi Displacer, Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Drowner of Hope to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes support cards like Ancient Stirrings and Path to Exile to help maintain board presence and deal with opposing threats. By utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games and outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a low-cost, artifact-heavy board presence to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful equipment. By leveraging cards that synergize well with artifacts, such as Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to build a strong battlefield and deal fast, efficient damage. Utilizing cards like Cranial Plating for additional damage boosts and evasion, the deck aims to win swiftly before the opponent can establish their own game plan. With a mix of creatures, equipment, and mana sources, this deck aims to maintain a consistent and threatening presence throughout the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on aggressively ramping out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Drowner of Hope, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer using mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Skyspawner. The deck also utilizes disruption through cards like Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer's ability to exile cards from the opponent's hand. With a versatile mana base and access to powerful colorless lands like Cavern of Souls and Eldrazi Temple, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disrupt their game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. It ramps into its powerful threats like Primeval Titan using ramp spells like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow. The deck also includes removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides card advantage and additional ramp. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with Valakut triggers and landfall effects.
